item.title: Beogram 4000: Alternate "Circuit Diagram 2" with 24V Scale Illumination Lamps
item.description:
I recently acquired a well-preserved Beogram 4000 service manual containing a unique supplementary diagram. This diagram, Circuit Diagram 2, outlines the control system and features a notable difference in the position scale illumination. Instead of the typical two 12V bulbs wired in series, it depicts two 24V bulbs connected in parallel to the 24V power source. This discovery complicated a recent interaction with Sonavor, who is currently restoring his own Beogram 4000...

item.title: Beogram 4000: New Main Capacitor Array with Integrated Efficient 24V Power Supply
item.description:
The Beogram 4000 is known to get quite hot, primarily due to its outdated voltage regulator-based power supply. To address this, a modern PCB design with a buck converter-based 24V supply was created as a replacement for the original power supply and capacitors. The new design features high-quality Panasonic electrolytic capacitors, Samsung ceramic capacitors for the motor phase, and a buck converter for the 24V power supply. It’s designed to be easily installed in place of the original components...

item.title: Beogram 4000: An Unusual Keypad PCB
item.description:
This article highlights a unique Beogram 4000 keyboard PCB. Typically, the two bulbs illuminating the position scale are wired in series, using two 12V bulbs connected between the 24V power source and ground. This setup is illustrated in the first image and diagram. Notably, this series configuration results in the bulbs having opposite polarity. This polarity difference is ideal for the author’s polarized LED replacement boards. The second image showcases these boards...
